moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6: Philidor's Defence, which I consider to be weak
moves.3. d4 exd4 4. Nxd4 c6 5. c4 h6: Black is playing "safe" but this is too slow.
moves.6. Nc3 Na6: Black develops a knight to the rim.
moves.7. g3 Qf6: That square was for Black's g8 Knight.
moves.8. Bg2 Qg6: Moving his queen twice for some flawed plan.
moves.9. O-O Bg4 10. f3: Black wastes 3 tempi just for this.
moves.12. Be3 Nc5 13. b4 Nd7: Here, White could play Nxe6 followed by Bxa7 because if ... b6, Then Qa4 and Black's king is in trouble.
Black has only developed his Queen and will now be overrun.
Closing the position, but resistance is futile.
moves.22. Nd5+ Kd8 23. Ra6a8 Ne7 24. Rxb8+ Nxb: A rook on the seventh rank always wins, they say.
moves.31... Kf7 32. Rxd7 Rd8 33. Rxe7+ Kxe7 34: Here Black ran out of time, but it's a clear win for White.
